question: Which institution has launched a new risk-based internal audit (RBIA) system for non-banking finance companies?
explanation:
The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has recently launched the risk-based internal audit (RBIA) system for some non-bank lenders and urban co-operative banks.
As per the notification, all deposit-taking NBFCs and NBFCs with an asset size of over Rs 5,000 crore, and urban co-operatives banks with assets of over Rs 500 crore will have to migrate to the new system.
